title: shap.TreeExplainer(model) results in ValueError
body:
I've trained and fit an XGBoost model, and I'm attempting to extract the shapley values using the shap package.

```
    # Create a XGBoost Classifier
    model = xgb.XGBClassifier( <list of parameters> )
    
    # Train the Model
    model.fit(X, y)

    # Use Tree SHAP algorithms to explain the output of ensemble tree models
    explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model)
```

I am getting the following error with the TreeExplainer call:

 ```
# Error Message:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ValueError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-8-3eb755b275a5> in <module>()
      1 # Create Shapley plots
----> 2 shapley_extraction.plot_shap_values(model, train_data[features], target, project_path=project_path)
      3 
      4 # Calculate prediction-level feature importance using Shapley values
      5 shap_prediction_data = shapley_extraction.concat_shap_values_to_predictions(prediction_data, 

/mnt/notebooks/shapley_extraction.py in plot_shap_values(model, X, target, project_path)
    140 
    141     # Calculate Shapley Values
--> 142     explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model)
    143     shap_values = explainer.shap_values(X)
    144 

/usr/local/anaconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/shap/explainers/tree.py in __init__(self, model, data, model_output, feature_dependence)
     89 
     90     def __init__(self, model, data = None, model_output = "margin", feature_dependence = "tree_path_dependent"):
---> 91         self.model = TreeEnsemble(model)
     92         if str(type(data)).endswith("pandas.core.frame.DataFrame'>"):
     93             self.data = data.values

/usr/local/anaconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/shap/explainers/tree.py in __init__(self, model)
    532         # build a dense numpy version of all the tree objects
    533         if self.trees is not None:
--> 534             max_nodes = np.max([len(t.values) for t in self.trees])
    535             assert len(np.unique([t.values.shape[1] for t in self.trees])) == 1, "All trees in the ensemble must have the same output dimension!"
    536             ntrees = len(self.trees)

/usr/local/anaconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/numpy/core/fromnumeric.py in amax(a, axis, out, keepdims, initial)
   2332     """
   2333     return _wrapreduction(a, np.maximum, 'max', axis, None, out, keepdims=keepdims,
-> 2334                           initial=initial)
   2335 
   2336 

/usr/local/anaconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/numpy/core/fromnumeric.py in _wrapreduction(obj, ufunc, method, axis, dtype, out, **kwargs)
     81                 return reduction(axis=axis, out=out, **passkwargs)
     82 
---> 83     return ufunc.reduce(obj, axis, dtype, out, **passkwargs)
     84 
     85 

ValueError: zero-size array to reduction operation maximum which has no identity

```

Here are the model parameters (in case this is relevant):

    # XGBClassifier(base_score=0.5, booster='gbtree', colsample_bylevel=1,
    #      colsample_bytree=1.0, gamma=1.3, learning_rate=0.01,
    #      max_delta_step=0, max_depth=10, min_child_weight=19, missing=nan,
    #      n_estimators=0, n_jobs=1, nthread=-1, objective='binary:logistic',
    #      random_state=0, reg_alpha=3, reg_lambda=1,
    #      scale_pos_weight=861.5615763546798, seed=27, silent=True, 
    #      subsample=0.8)

Here are my versions of packages:
shap                               0.27.0
scikit-learn                     0.19.1
xgboost                          0.81

Any idea on what could be causing this error? Thanks.
